intro: Humboltia laxa, commonly known as the coastal morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the western coast of North America. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along coastal areas. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often opening in the morning. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and usually have a slightly hairy texture. Humboltia laxa is adapted to coastal environments, tolerating salt spray and strong winds.
